adventure_overview: Lions and adult partners will take a walk to explore the outdoors.  Along the way, they will see and identify things that are natural and things that are man-made. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Identify the Cub Scout Six Essentials. Show what you do with each item.

activities.name: Guess the Cub Scout Six Essential
activities.description: Play a game of charades to identify the Cub Scout Six Essentials.

activities.name: Kim’s Game Cub Scout Six Essentials
activities.description: Play Kim’s Game to help Cub Scouts learn about the Cub Scout Six Essentials.

requirements.text: With your den, pack, or family, take a walk outside spending for at least 20 minutes exploring the outdoors with your Cub Scout Six Essentials.  While outside, identify things that you see with your Lion adult partner that are natural and things that are manmade.

activities.name: A Different Point of View
activities.description: During the walk stop and change where you are looking by moving your body.

activities.name: I Spy Something Natural
activities.description: While on a walk,  play “I Spy” to identify natural items and things that are man-made.

activities.name: Outdoor Scavenger Hunt Lion
activities.description: While on a walk play a scavenger hunt for things that are natural.

requirements.text: Identify common animals that are found where you live.  Separate those animals into domesticated and wild.

activities.name: Animal Craft
activities.description: Using craft supplies make a domesticated animal and a wild animal.

activities.name: Visit an Animal Rescue
activities.description: Travel to an animal rescue that has both wild and domestic animals.

activities.name: Wild or Domestic
activities.description: Matching activity for wild and domesticated animals.
